p: From October 2014 to April 2016, a total of 648 fecal samples of wild and domestic animals belonging to three forest fragments areas were tested for the NSP3 gene by qualitative qPCR, and 178 (27.5%) were positive for RVA, distributed among the species: birds (23.6%), canines (21.35%), bats (17.98%), cattle (14.6%), horses (8.43%), small rodents (6.74%), swine (3.93%) and felines (3.37%). The CT interval ranged from 28.47 to 39.9 (mean of 36.79) with the following mean values per species: horses (34.11), birds (34.24), cattle (36.02), canines and chiropterans (37.1), rodents (37.76), swine (37.91) and felines (38.36).
